Condition A:
Peer-averaged neural patterns for 4 peers (Nice-Predictable, Mean-Predictable,
 Nice-Unpredictable, Mean-Unpredictable). Averaged across 32 trials each -> Brain RDM (4x4 dissimilarities).
Condition B:
Disposition model RDM (clusters peers by valence: Nice peers more similar,
 Mean peers more similar).
Comparison: Brain RDM vs. Disposition model — tests whether neural similarity reflects valence grouping.
SA vs. Non-SA: Compare alignment (Brain–Disposition correlation) between SA and Non-SA groups.

Condition A:
Peer-averaged neural patterns for 4 peers (Nice-Predictable, Mean-Predictable, 
Nice-Unpredictable, Mean-Unpredictable). Averaged across 32 trials each -> Brain RDM (4x4 dissimilarities).
Condition B:
Predictability model RDM (clusters peers by predictability: Predictable peers more similar,
 Unpredictable peers more similar).
Comparison: Brain RDM vs. Predictability model — tests whether neural similarity reflects predictability grouping.
SA vs. Non-SA: Compare alignment (Brain–Predictability correlation) between SA and Non-SA groups.

Condition A:
Peer-averaged neural patterns for 4 peers (Nice-Predictable, Mean-Predictable, 
Nice-Unpredictable, Mean-Unpredictable). Averaged across 32 trials each -> Brain RDM (4x4 dissimilarities).
Condition B:
Negativity model RDM (asymmetric weighting: Mean peers more dissimilar from Nice peers, 
reflecting negativity bias).
Comparison: Brain RDM vs. Negativity model — tests whether neural similarity reflects stronger separation for Mean peers.
SA vs. Non-SA: Compare alignment (Brain–Negativity correlation) between SA and Non-SA groups.
